forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Slight Chance Drizzle
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle after 2am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As twilight descends on Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a hint of moisture, with a slight chance of drizzle lingering in the early hours. The sky, draped in a cloak of clouds, offers a subdued warmth with temperatures dipping toward the mid-fifties. A gentle wind sweeps through the streets, whispering tales of the day gone by. The horizon, while mostly veiled in the soft embrace of marine layer fog, suggests occasional fragments of clear skies, hinting at a shift toward clearer conditions by morning.

Looking ahead to Tuesday, the grey will gradually yield to sunshine, with temperatures nudging toward the low sixties. The promise of a brightening day beckons outdoor pursuits, whether it be a stroll along the waterfront or a leisurely coffee at a local café, with the invigorating breeze adding a delightful touch. Dress in layers to warm against the coolness of the morning and prepare for the gentle escalation of the afternoon’s sun. As the city awakens, it will present a canvas of potential, where each moment can be crafted into something memorable against the backdrop of emerging light.
